intro: Fimbristylis stipitata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded soils, often found in marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny flowers. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. Fimbristylis stipitata plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
